HTML_Tutorial.Introduction: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard language for creating web pages. It uses a system of tags to define the structure and layout of a webpage.

1_Basic_Structure_of_HTML_Document.Code:
Welcome to HTML

This is a paragraph.

Explanation.html: Root element of the HTML document.
Explanation.head: Contains metadata (e.g., <title> for the page title).
Explanation.body: Contains the visible content of the webpage.

Attributes.width: Sets the width of the image.

3_Attributes.Explanation: Attributes provide additional information about elements and are always written in the format name="value".

Details.target: Opens the link in a new tab.

4_HTML_Forms.Code:
<form action="/submit" method="post">
  <label for="name">Name:</label>
  <input type="text" id="name" name="name">
  
  <label for="email">Email:</label>
  <input type="email" id="email" name="email">

  <input type="submit" value="Submit">
</form>

Explanation.action: URL to send the form data.

6_HTML_Semantic_Elements.Explanation: Semantic elements clearly define the purpose of the content.

Examples.article: Represents an independent piece of content.
